pullRequest.title: Add default allowQueriesOnUiThread to true also for SyncConfiguration
pullRequest.bodyText:
Fixes #7177
Now allowQueriesOnUiThread defaults to true also for sync configs.
Added missing tests for both allowQueriesOnUiThread and allowWritesOnUiThread when creating synced configs..

commit.message: Now allowQueriesOnUiThread defaults to true also for sync configs
Added missing tests for allowWritesOnUiThread too

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            * [SyncConfiguration] The `SyncConfiguration.Builder.allowQueriesOnUiThread` flag was wrongly initialized to `false` keeping users from running queries from the UI thread when using synced Realms. It now defaults to `true`, allowing queries to be run from the UI. See [#7177](https://github.com/realm/realm-java/issues/7177)
          
          
            
            * [SyncConfiguration] The `SyncConfiguration.Builder.allowQueriesOnUiThread` flag was wrongly initialized to `false` keeping users from running queries from the UI thread when using synced Realms. It now defaults to `true`, allowing queries to be run from the UI. (Issue [#7177](https://github.com/realm/realm-java/issues/7177), since 10.0.0)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -7,6 +7,7 @@
 * None.
 
 ### Fixes
+* [SyncConfiguration] The `SyncConfiguration.Builder.allowQueriesOnUiThread` flag was wrongly initialized to `false` keeping users from running queries from the UI thread when using synced Realms. It now defaults to `true`, allowing queries to be run from the UI. See [#7177](https://github.com/realm/realm-java/issues/7177)
